Major Legislative Enactments of 2021

to produce and show to the Commissioner-General any document which is in his possession or power and which
is in the opinion of the Commissioner-General necessary for arriving at the truth of the matters being inquired

(iii) 
refuses to be affirmed or sworn in as a witness before the Commissioner-General; or
(iv)  defaults in complying with any direction given by the Commissioner-General, or who when called upon to furnish
a return knowingly makes or furnishes or caused to be furnished a false return or a return containing any false
under this section, commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction thereof after summary trial before a
Magistrate to a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or to imprisonment of either description for a term not
exceeding six months or to both such fine and imprisonment.
